title: Brake Pad Wear Inspection

body.body: Before starting work, ensure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported. This will help prevent it from falling and causing injury to the operator or damage to the motorcycle.
Front Brake Wear Inspection - D54; D64; DC3; DC4; DD2; DP3; DP4; DCZ; DPZ
Do not replace individual brake pads; replace all of the pads in the brake caliper. Replacing individual pads will reduce braking efficiency and may cause loss of motorcycle control and an accident.

In accordance with the Scheduled Maintenance chart, inspect the brake pads for wear. The minimum thickness of the front brake pad lining material is 1 mm. An area of the brake backing plate is raised and will cause the front brake to squeal as a notification to the rider when the brake pad(s) are below the minimum thickness, replace all the brake pads on that wheel.

metadata.ModelsTaxonomyLink: DCZ; DPZ; D64; D54; DP4; DC4; DD2; DC3; DP3

body.body: Rear Brake Wear Inspection DD2 DC3 DP3
Do not replace individual brake pads; replace both pads in the brake caliper. Replacing individual pads will reduce braking efficiency and may cause loss of motorcycle control and an accident.

In accordance with the Scheduled Maintenance chart, inspect the rear brake pads for wear. The minimum thickness of lining material for the rear brake pad is 1.5 mm. If any pad has worn to the bottom of the groove in the pad centre, replace all the brake pads on that wheel.
